page.title: 14THE CALDER CANAL - DEWSBURY
page.content: The Calder Canal which runs alongside the River Calder passes through Mirfield and Ravensthorpe. The canal, first owned by the Aire and Calder Navigation Company and then by the Calder and Hebble Navigation Company, was{nationalised}in 1948. It's main use in past years was for transporting {coal}from local pits to the recently closed Thornhill power station and to nearby gas and chemical works. Nowadays, the canal is rarely used for industrial purposes and is far cleaner as local mills no longer pollute it and {British Waterways}has spent a great deal of money cleaning it. It is mainly used by holidaymakers for {cruising}and for educational trips by local schools utilising the {'Calder Lady'}which takes children through locks, past old mills and into the countryside.
